jobPostingInfo.title: Systems Engineer IV (TS/SCI)
jobPostingInfo.jobDescription:
Job Details

New ideas are all around us, but only a few will change the world. That’s our focus at JPL. We ask the biggest questions, then search the universe for answers—literally. We build upon ideas that have guided generations, then share our discoveries to inspire generations to come. Your mission—your opportunity—is to seek out the answers that bring us one step closer. If you’re driven to discover, create, and inspire something that lasts a lifetime and beyond, you’re ready for JPL.

Located in Pasadena, California, JPL has a campus-like environment situated on 177 acres in the foothills of the San Gabriel Mountains and offers a work environment unlike any other: we inspire passion, foster innovation, build collaboration, and reward excellence.

Responsibilities:

We are seeking a Mission System Systems Engineer to support the National Security Program Office (NSPO). As a part of the Special Programs Mission System Engineering Group (394Z), you report administratively to the Technical Group Supervisor and programmatically to the Mission Manager.

You will be a Systems Engineer responsible for the supporting the development, implementation, and deployment of the Ground Data System (GDS), Science Data System (SDS), and Mission Operations System (MOS). This role ensures the Mission System meets the project needs and objectives. You will work with a multidisciplinary, cross-organizational teams inside and outside JPL.

Tasks include but not limited to:

  • Provide technical leadership for the mission system team
  • Lead and coordinate complex mission system trade studies
  • Manage and resolve anomalies, discrepancies, and problems reported
  • Verification and validation (V&V) of the mission system requirements
  • Lead all aspects of system level tests, rehearsals, and demonstrations
  • Present in engineering and management reviews

Required:

  • Bachelor's degree in Engineering or related technical subject area with typically a minimum of 9 years of related experience; Master's degree with a minimum of 7 years of related experience; or PhD with a minimum of 5 years related experience.
  • Knowledge of Mission Control Systems (MCS) and/or Science Data Systems (SDS)
  • Excellent organizational ability and proactive attitude for completing work you're leading.
  • Superior written and oral communications skills.
  • Demonstrated proficiency in the application of system engineering practices.
  • Significant expertise in project lifecycle management and systems engineering

Desired:

  • Experience and knowledge in flight project ground and/or operations systems
  • Experience managing resources and schedules with multi-organizational teams
  • Knowledge of applicable JPL, industry, and/or academic practices and standards for design and development of complex spacecraft activities
  • Understanding and wide application of advanced principles, theories, concepts and techniques in spacecraft system engineering as it pertains to orbital flight projects.

Note: Must have an active Top Secret (TS) clearance based upon Single Scope Background Investigation (SSBI) within a 5 year scope and must be approved for Sensitive Compartmented Information (SCI) accesses

JPL has a catalog of benefits and perks that span from the traditional to the unique. This includes a variety of health, dental, vision, wellbeing, and retirement plans, paid time off, learning, rideshare, childcare, flexible schedule, parental leave and many more. Our focus is on work-life balance, and living healthy, fulfilling lives as we Dare Mighty Things Together. For benefits eligible positions, benefits are effective the first day of the month coincident with or immediately following the employee’s start date.

For further benefits information click Benefits and Perks
